intro: Hedysarum tongtianhense, commonly known as the Tibetan milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Tibetan Plateau. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers arranged in dense clusters, and its leaves are trifoliate, with three small leaflets. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in harsh, high-altitude environments. Hedysarum tongtianhense is valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
